channel.title: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?

item.title: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:70, topic:374308”][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=470292.msg3735139#msg3735139 date=1314903879]

And here’s the cables: http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6644172/Wikileaks_Cables__Full__Unredacted__and_Decrypted_(cables.csv)

Is that the insurance.aes256 file unencrypted?

Edit: I can’t decrypt the insurance.aes256 file I’ve had for months with the password provided on that torrent, “ACollectionOfDiplomaticHistorySince_1966_ToThe_PresentDay#”
[/quote]It isn’t. It’s a larger compilation of uncensored cables, which includes the insurance documents.[/quote]Yikes.

Read full topic

item.source: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?

item.title: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Bumped for this relevant article I read this morning:

SPIEGEL ONLINE

Leak at WikiLeaks: Accidental Release of US Cables Endangers Sources - SPIEGEL...

A WikiLeaks file containing the original leaked US State Department cables has inadvertently been released onto the Internet. The documents have not been edited to protect sources, meaning that the lives of informants could be at risk.

Read full topic
item.source: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?

item.title: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Stories in the majority of religions are very common to stories in other religions because they’re all part of the mythosphere. The mythosphere is important to developing people and civilizations. There have been studies that prove that this is critical to normal development. If you’re interested, then you look them up.

Children benefit from myths, as long as they get to know the truth when they grow up.

And myths have benefited civilizations, but with the globalization and other changes they aren’t needed anymore. Old myths are about the superiority of a fellow citizen, and seek to encourage you. Younger myths are about punishing the bad things, and even younger myths are about doing good. Today, these myths make people believe that they are doing good, when they actually are doing something bad.

Read full topic
item.source: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?

item.title: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Religion and creation stories are very important to young ones and every civilization, but once it has developed they really need to see it for what it is: Humans trying to understand something they can’t.

Surely though one could argue it’s just as detrimental to civilizations in the long run since time and time again extremists can, will and do kill people in this world because of a belief that something better awaits them, that this world doesn’t really matter, to them at least. Just a thought.

Read full topic

item.source: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?

item.title: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:56, topic:374308”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=470292.msg3465193#msg3465193 date=1294843261]

The Native Americans aren’t fighting back anymore… LOL!

It worked!

Perhaps the best thing that could happen is the establishment of American control (complete control), followed by the release of an American-written ‘New testament’ Koran equivalent.

They should abolish Islam altogether and establish an American style hollywood in Iraq! They can have all these celebrities that take drugs and everything. That’ll stop them from fighting back!

I’d like to see all religion abolished, personally. I’m catholic because I was baptised at birth, but I’d be lying if I said I believed in their teachings. I’m certainly not a practicing catholic, that’s for sure… unless you count commercialised holidays such as christmas.

Anyway, the main difference with practitioners of islam and practitioners of catholicism is that the catholics have updated their interpretations of the teachings found in their holy book.
For example, most catholics consider the book highly symbolic these days, rather than something to be taken literally.
Muslims on the other hand have leaders who take the book literally, who issue fatwas calling for the killing of infidels, and so on.
And that’s the big difference – while there are some fucking disgusting catholicschristians (eg, Westboro Baptist Church), the overall leader of the catholic religion, Pope Benedict, doesn’t call for violence or incite it.

There are always people who take old documents as fact, and people who take it as guidelines. The same happens with the US Constitution and judges.

Either way, everyone needs to grow the fuck up, get with the times, and stop believing in that bullshit after a certain age. Religion and creation stories are very important to young ones and every civilization, but once it has developed they really need to see it for what it is: Humans trying to understand something they can’t.
[/quote]… what? How is religion important “to young ones”? Nobody in my fucking country teaches kids dick about faith from a believers perspective, and parently certainly don’t.[/quote]

Stories in the majority of religions are very common to stories in other religions because they’re all part of the mythosphere. The mythosphere is important to developing people and civilizations. There have been studies that prove that this is critical to normal development. If you’re interested, then you look them up.

Read full topic

Lothy:

I will admit that Ziva David is extremely attractive… Probably because the actress that portrays her (Cote de Pablo) is from Chile, and not israel.

Wow shit Lothy you fap to her daily don’t you? I’ve never seen a post by you containing the words ‘Israel’ and/or ‘jew’ without also containing a reference to Cote de Pablo

item.title: Wikileaks: A setup? A false flag?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:55, topic:374308”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=470292.msg3465193#msg3465193 date=1294843261]
There are always people who take old documents as fact, and people who take it as guidelines. The same happens with the US Constitution and judges.

Either way, everyone needs to grow the fuck up, get with the times, and stop believing in that bullshit after a certain age. Religion and creation stories are very important to young ones and every civilization, but once it has developed they really need to see it for what it is: Humans trying to understand something they can’t.
[/quote]

But we can understand it. Only with the help of science, not religion. I agree with you though, but getting rid of religion is very hard. Until then, I think all religions, at least the three major ones, should be treated equally. That’s why I hate the general Muslim bashing, because it’s usually done by Christians and Jews.[/quote]
I’d just like to point out here and now that I give jews a much harder time than I give muslims, both online and in the real world.
I will admit that Ziva David is extremely attractive… Probably because the actress that portrays her (Cote de Pablo) is from Chile, and not israel.

Read full topic

It worked!

Perhaps the best thing that could happen is the establishment of American control (complete control), followed by the release of an American-written ‘New testament’ Koran equivalent.

They should abolish Islam altogether and establish an American style hollywood in Iraq! They can have all these celebrities that take drugs and everything. That’ll stop them from fighting back!

I’d like to see all religion abolished, personally. I’m catholic because I was baptised at birth, but I’d be lying if I said I believed in their teachings. I’m certainly not a practicing catholic, that’s for sure… unless you count commercialised holidays such as christmas.

Anyway, the main difference with practitioners of islam and practitioners of catholicism is that the catholics have updated their interpretations of the teachings found in their holy book.
For example, most catholics consider the book highly symbolic these days, rather than something to be taken literally.
Muslims on the other hand have leaders who take the book literally, who issue fatwas calling for the killing of infidels, and so on.
And that’s the big difference – while there are some fucking disgusting catholicschristians (eg, Westboro Baptist Church), the overall leader of the catholic religion, Pope Benedict, doesn’t call for violence or incite it.
[/quote]

There are always people who take old documents as fact, and people who take it as guidelines. The same happens with the US Constitution and judges.

Either way, everyone needs to grow the fuck up, get with the times, and stop believing in that bullshit after a certain age. Religion and creation stories are very important to young ones and every civilization, but once it has developed they really need to see it for what it is: Humans trying to understand something they can’t.[/quote]… what? How is religion important “to young ones”? Nobody in my fucking country teaches kids dick about faith from a believers perspective, and parently certainly don’t.

item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:54, topic:374308”]There are always people who take old documents as fact, and people who take it as guidelines. The same happens with the US Constitution and judges.

Either way, everyone needs to grow the fuck up, get with the times, and stop believing in that bullshit after a certain age. Religion and creation stories are very important to young ones and every civilization, but once it has developed they really need to see it for what it is: Humans trying to understand something they can’t.[/quote]

But we can understand it. Only with the help of science, not religion. I agree with you though, but getting rid of religion is very hard. Until then, I think all religions, at least the three major ones, should be treated equally. That’s why I hate the general Muslim bashing, because it’s usually done by Christians and Jews.

The Native Americans aren’t fighting back anymore… LOL!

It worked!

Perhaps the best thing that could happen is the establishment of American control (complete control), followed by the release of an American-written ‘New testament’ Koran equivalent.

They should abolish Islam altogether and establish an American style hollywood in Iraq! They can have all these celebrities that take drugs and everything. That’ll stop them from fighting back!
[/quote]
I’d like to see all religion abolished, personally. I’m catholic because I was baptised at birth, but I’d be lying if I said I believed in their teachings. I’m certainly not a practicing catholic, that’s for sure… unless you count commercialised holidays such as christmas.

Anyway, the main difference with practitioners of islam and practitioners of catholicism is that the catholics have updated their interpretations of the teachings found in their holy book.
For example, most catholics consider the book highly symbolic these days, rather than something to be taken literally.
Muslims on the other hand have leaders who take the book literally, who issue fatwas calling for the killing of infidels, and so on.
And that’s the big difference – while there are some fucking disgusting catholicschristians (eg, Westboro Baptist Church), the overall leader of the catholic religion, Pope Benedict, doesn’t call for violence or incite it.[/quote]

There are always people who take old documents as fact, and people who take it as guidelines. The same happens with the US Constitution and judges.

Either way, everyone needs to grow the fuck up, get with the times, and stop believing in that bullshit after a certain age. Religion and creation stories are very important to young ones and every civilization, but once it has developed they really need to see it for what it is: Humans trying to understand something they can’t.

For example, most catholics consider the book highly symbolic these days, rather than something to be taken literally.

Perhaps the best thing that could happen is the establishment of American control (complete control), followed by the release of an American-written ‘New testament’ Koran equivalent.

They should abolish Islam altogether and establish an American style hollywood in Iraq! They can have all these celebrities that take drugs and everything. That’ll stop them from fighting back![/quote]
I’d like to see all religion abolished, personally. I’m catholic because I was baptised at birth, but I’d be lying if I said I believed in their teachings. I’m certainly not a practicing catholic, that’s for sure… unless you count commercialised holidays such as christmas.

Anyway, the main difference with practitioners of islam and practitioners of catholicism is that the catholics have updated their interpretations of the teachings found in their holy book.
For example, most catholics consider the book highly symbolic these days, rather than something to be taken literally.
